title: num_workers caused radom problem in dataloader
body_html:
🐛 Bug

Description

If set num_workers != 0, the random functions do no work in getitem(self, index) of dataloader

Environment

The results of the following codes should not be zero due to randomness. But once we set num_workers!=0, the result is 0.
You can get the script and run it with:

import torch
import torch.utils.data as Data
import numpy as np


class loader(Data.Dataset):
    def __init__(self, data_array,
                 frames=500):
        self.data_array = data_array
        self.frames = frames

    def __getitem__(self, index):
        data = data_array[index]
        length =  data.shape[0]
        start_point = np.random.randint(length - self.frames+1)
        data = data[start_point:start_point+self.frames]
        return data

    def __len__(self):
        return self.data_array.shape[0]

data_array = np.random.randn(400,1000)
data_loader = Data.DataLoader(loader(data_array),batch_size=400,num_workers=4)

for batch_idx, inputs in enumerate(data_loader):
    a = inputs[0]

for batch_idx, inputs in enumerate(data_loader):
    b = inputs[0]

print(abs(a-b).max())
  • PyTorch Version :　0.4.1
  • OS : Ubunto 16.04
  • How you installed PyTorch: pip
  • Python version: python3.6.3
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: None
  • GPU models and configuration: None
  • Any other relevant information:

body:
## 🐛 Bug

<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->

## Description

If set num_workers != 0, the random functions do no work in  __getitem__(self, index) of dataloader

<!-- If you have a code sample, error messages, stack traces, please provide it here as well -->


<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->

## Environment
The results of the following codes should not be zero due to randomness. But once we set num_workers!=0, the result is 0.
You can get the script and run it with:
```
import torch
import torch.utils.data as Data
import numpy as np


class loader(Data.Dataset):
    def __init__(self, data_array,
                 frames=500):
        self.data_array = data_array
        self.frames = frames

    def __getitem__(self, index):
        data = data_array[index]
        length =  data.shape[0]
        start_point = np.random.randint(length - self.frames+1)
        data = data[start_point:start_point+self.frames]
        return data

    def __len__(self):
        return self.data_array.shape[0]

data_array = np.random.randn(400,1000)
data_loader = Data.DataLoader(loader(data_array),batch_size=400,num_workers=4)

for batch_idx, inputs in enumerate(data_loader):
    a = inputs[0]

for batch_idx, inputs in enumerate(data_loader):
    b = inputs[0]

print(abs(a-b).max())
```

 - PyTorch Version :　0.4.1
 - OS : Ubunto 16.04
 - How you installed PyTorch: pip
 - Python version: python3.6.3
 - CUDA/cuDNN version: None
 - GPU models and configuration: None
 - Any other relevant information:
